original_title: 2023 Halloween Hackfest: Musical Jack-o-Lanterns Harmonize for Halloween
original_content:
Halloween is many things to many people. For some, its a chance to dress up and let loose. For others, its a chance to give everyone in the neighborhood a jump scare. For [Aaron], its the perfect time to put on a show in the yard with some musical, light-up jack-o-lanterns.
[Aaron] came across some deeply-discounted light-up jack-o-lanterns a few years ago. They all had one of those Try Me buttons thats powered by a couple of coin cells and uses a temporary two-wire connection to the PCB, and [Aaron] figured he could remotely control them using this port of sorts.
Now the guts are made of addressable RGB LEDs that are connected through the battery compartment via weatherproofed pigtails.
On the control side, he has a Raspberry Pi 3, an amplifier, and a couple of power supplies all housed in a weatherproof box. Since its not possible to multiplex both the lights and the audio on a Pi 3, he added a USB sound card into the mix.
Be sure to check out the awesome demo video after the break, followed by a pumpkin conversion video.
If youre more into scaring people, carve up an animated evil-eye pumpkin.
title: リモコンで操作可能な光るジャックオーランタンを作成！
body: ハロウィンの雰囲気を楽しむため、[Aaron]さんは電子工作で楽器付きのジャックオーランタンを作りました。Raspberry Piを使用し、アドレス可能なRGB LEDを制御しています。詳細は動画をチェックしてください。もし人を怖がらせる方が好きなら、動く目玉のジャックオーランタンも試してみてください。
